channel.title: Ignoring Files :: K-State CIS 400 Textbook
channel.description: Git can be asked to ignore specific files by adding a pattern matching the file to a special text file named .gitignore. This file should be placed in the top level of the project directory. We typically use this to ignore temporary files, build files, and files whose contents we donâ€™t want posted on GitHub (i.e. configuration files with passwords and secrets). GitHub offers a collection of prepared .gitignore files for popular languages and platforms, at https://github.
